Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl

Class SyncGuiceModule

java.lang.Object
com.google.inject.AbstractModule
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl.SyncGuiceModule
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.inject.Module
public class SyncGuiceModule extends com.google.inject.AbstractModule
Configures a module for Google's Guice dependency injector.

    • getJobDataStorage

      @Provides public ISyncJobDataStorage getJobDataStorage()
      Returns the job data storage as fetched from getSyncTargetFactory().ISyncTargetFactory.getJobDataStorage()

      In case the sync target factory does not return an instance, the default SyncJobDataMemoryStorage is used instead.

      Returns:
      an ISyncJobDataStorage.

    • getHttpClient

      @Provides public okhttp3.OkHttpClient getHttpClient()
      Returns a singleton OkHttpClient instance.
      Returns:
      a OkHttpClient or null.

    • getPlatformSchedulerProvider

      @Singleton @Provides public IPlatformScheduler getPlatformSchedulerProvider()
      Provide a platform dependent scheduler.

      First a service implementing IPlatformSchedulerProvider is detected using ServiceLoader. If there is none, then the default Java scheduler NativeThreadPoolScheduler is used.
      If there are more implementation for this service, the first one is used. It depends on the class loader to determine the order of the implementation. So in reality it can not be determined and maybe totally random. However, this does not seem to be a problem as there should only be a single service implementation available - one for each platform.

      The scheduler is a singleton and the same instance is returned for consecutive calls.

      Returns:
      the first service found or null if there is none.

    • getSettings

      @Provides public ISettingsModel getSettings()
      Provides settings with validated lanugages.

      Fetches the settings from the sync target factory, validates the languages and returns a new instance with the same settings and validated languages. The result is not cached internally but this is done on every call.

      Returns:
      settings with validated languages
